com.skobbler.ngx.routing

Class SKRouteManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.skobbler.ngx.routing.SKRouteManager

  • public final class SKRouteManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Class which handles routing methods.
    Version:
    2.4

      • calculateRoute

        public void calculateRoute(SKRouteSettings route)
        Calculates a route and displays it on the map. It clears the previous route drawn on the map. Route calculation succeed and failure methods are called.
        Parameters:
        route - contains information about the route (startPoint,destinationPoint, viaPoints, routeMode, other advanced settings)

      • getCurrentRouteMode

        public SKRouteSettings.SKRouteMode getCurrentRouteMode()
        Returns the last route mode set when calculating a route.
        Returns:
        the last route mode set when calculating a route.

      • calculateRouteWithPoints

        public void calculateRouteWithPoints(java.util.List<SKPosition> points,
                            SKRouteSettings routeSettings)
        Calculates a route based on a list of points.
        Parameters:
        points -
        routeSettings - . Parameters that are taken into consideration from SKRouteSettings are : routeMode, downloadRouteCorridor, countryCodesReturned, extendedRoutePointsReturned and requestAdvices.

        Clears current route from the map, including alternatives.

      • zoomMapToCurrentRoute

        Zooms to the current route if any.

      • zoomToRoute

        public void zoomToRoute(float widthPadding,
               float heightPadding,
               int offsetPixelsTop,
               int offsetPixelsBottom,
               int offsetPixelsLeft,
               int offsetPixelsRight)
        Auto zooms to the current route if any s.t both start and destination are visible on the screen
        Parameters:
        widthPadding - Width relative padding ~ 1.0 = route fits exactly in screen, larger values zooms out
        heightPadding - Height relative padding ~ 1.0 = route fits exactly in screen, larger values zooms out
        offsetPixelsTop - pixels to leave at the top of the screen
        offsetPixelsBottom - pixels to leave at the bottom of the screen
        offsetPixelsLeft - pixels to leave at the left of the screen
        offsetPixelsRight - pixels to leave at the right of the screen

      • getRouteInfo

        public SKRouteInfo getRouteInfo(int routeUniqueId)
        Gets some of the information about the route identified by its unique id.
        Parameters:
        routeUniqueId - the unique Id of the route that is selected as main. If that route does not exist anymore, the selection will fail.
        Returns:
        information about the route

      • setCurrentRoute

        public boolean setCurrentRoute(int routeIndex)
        Selects a route to be the current one, based on its calculation order: the one that is rendered and matched.
        Parameters:
        routeIndex -
        Returns:
        true if the selection succeeded

      • setCurrentRouteByUniqueId

        public boolean setCurrentRouteByUniqueId(int routeUniqueId)
        Selects a route to be the current one (e.g. the one to render and navigate on). By default the main route is the first calculated route. The route is given by its unique id.
        Parameters:
        routeUniqueId - unique id of the route
        Returns:
        true if the selection succeeded

      • getCountriesTraversedByRouteByUniqueId

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getCountriesTraversedByRouteByUniqueId(int routeUniqueId)
        Gets the countries traversed by the route identified by its unique Id. The countries list has to be requested when launching the route's computation.
        Parameters:
        routeUniqueId - the unique Id of the route that is selected as main. If that route does not exist anymore, the method will fail and the output list will be empty.
        Returns:
        array of country codes that are traversed by a route

      • getExtendedRoutePointsForRoute

        public java.util.List<SKExtendedRoutePosition> getExtendedRoutePointsForRoute(int routeUniqueId)
        Gets a list of points containing extra route information for a calculated route identified by its unique id. The extended route points list has to be requested when launching the route's computation. See #setExtendedPointsReturned(boolean)
        Parameters:
        routeUniqueId - the unique Id of the route that is selected as main. If that route does not exist anymore, the method will fail.
        Returns:
        list of points containing extra route information

      • getCoordinatesForRoute

        public java.util.List<SKCoordinate> getCoordinatesForRoute(int routeUniqueId)
        Gets the list of GPS coordinates for the route identified by its unique Id. The points are filled only when the route is a successfully and completely calculated, case in which the list is initially cleared.
        Parameters:
        routeUniqueId - the unique Id of the route that is selected as main. If that route does not exist anymore, the method will fail.
        Returns:
        the list of GPS points: long,lat,long,lat ...

      • getAdviceList

        public java.util.List<SKRouteAdvice> getAdviceList(SKMaps.SKDistanceUnitType distanceFormat)
        Returns the list of advice for current route.
        Returns:
        the list of advice for current route.

      • createRouteFromTrackElement

        public boolean createRouteFromTrackElement(SKTrackElement trackElement,
                                  SKRouteSettings.SKRouteMode routeMode,
                                  boolean downloadRouteCorridor,
                                  boolean countryCodes,
                                  boolean extendedPoints)
        Starts a route calculation based on the provided track element
        Parameters:
        trackElement - the track element that the route should should be based on
        routeMode - the mode for which the route calculation will be performed. See SKRouteSettings.SKRouteMode
        downloadRouteCorridor - route corridor will be downloaded if set to true
        countryCodes - traversed country codes will be returned if set to true
        extendedPoints - points containing extra information will be returned if set to true
        Returns:
        true for success , false otherwise.

      • getAudioAdvisorSettings

        public SKAdvisorSettings getAudioAdvisorSettings()
        Returns the audio advisor settings.
        Returns:
        the audio advisor settings

      • setAudioAdvisorSettings

        public boolean setAudioAdvisorSettings(SKAdvisorSettings audioAdvisorSettings)
        Sets the settings for the audio advisor.
        Parameters:
        audioAdvisorSettings - new settings for the audio advisor.
        Returns:
        true if everything was set , false otherwise.

      • informAboutInternetStatus

        public void informAboutInternetStatus(boolean internetAvailable)
        Informs the library of the current internet status. When the internet is turned off, the ongoing online routing will fail.
        Parameters:
        internetAvailable - internet availability on the device

      • removeViaPoint

        public void removeViaPoint(int viaPointUniqueId)
        Removes a via point from the current route. The via point is identfied based on its unique Id. The method will launch: - a rerouting, in navigation mode - the recalculation of the current route, in map mode Note that: 1. if the via point can not be identified (i.e. there is no via point with that id), the call to this method will have no effect. 2. if there are multiple via points in the current route, having the same id as the one passed to this method, all these via-points will be removed.
        Parameters:
        viaPointUniqueId - - the unique id of the via point to be removed.

      • addViaPoint

        public void addViaPoint(SKViaPoint viaPointToBeAdded,
               int afterViaId)
        Adds a via point to the current route and launches: - a rerouting, in navigation mode - the recalculation of the current route, in map mode
        Parameters:
        viaPointToBeAdded - - the introduced via point
        afterViaId - - it identifies the via points after which the new via point is inserted. When this id does not exist, the new via point is inserted at the beginning. So use a non existent id (E.g. reserve -1 for that) in order to insert a via after the start position

      • saveRouteToCache

        public boolean saveRouteToCache(int routeID)
        Saves the route with a given identifier to the cache. Later this route can be reused without the need to recalculate it. NOTE THAT the route has to be notified as completely and successfully calculated AND should not have been cleared in the mean time. The method fails for routes not respecting this condition.
        Parameters:
        routeID - The id of the route, which can be obtained from SKRouteListener.onRouteCalculationCompleted(SKRouteInfo) . Important !!! Save the route after SKRouteListener.onAllRoutesCompleted() is called.
        Returns:
        true for success false otherwise.

      • removeRouteFromCache

        public void removeRouteFromCache(int routeID)
        Removes the route with a given identifier from the cache.
        Parameters:
        routeID - id of the route

      • clearAllRoutesFromCache

        public void clearAllRoutesFromCache()
        Removes all the cached routes.

      • loadRouteFromCache

        public void loadRouteFromCache(int routeID)
        Loads the route with a given identifier from the cache. The route will be rendered on the map.
        Parameters:
        routeID - id of the route.

      • enablePedestrianTrail

        public void enablePedestrianTrail(boolean enabled,
                         int smoothLevel)

      • renderRouteAsPedestrian

        public boolean renderRouteAsPedestrian(int routeUniqueId)
        Returns:
        true when the route id is present
